I love the fabric, it's soft and comfortable and wears really well even after washing/drying. I found the fit to be accurate, I am anything between a 6 through a 10 depending on brand. I ordered a 6 and it's relaxed enough but not baggy or saggy. For reference, I am 5'4 between 135-139 pounds and 57 yrs old. Might be too short for someone 5'6 or taller.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Matador GlobeRider45 Travel Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
All the reviews are right. It is a fantastically designed bag with comfortable shoulder straps, great carry options and amazing pockets. The only downside is the price and maybe the interior bungee straps. 
So far I have taken it for week long work trips and a two week adventure paired with my sling cross body bag. I am 5'7" and while it is square and fits all I want/need, it does not stick outside of my frame to bump into things. It fits in American Domestic overhead bins and it easy to grab and slide in and out especially if I don't have a jacket shoved in the mesh front pocket.
review.name: Kicking myself for not getting it sooner

review.reviewBody: I just took this pack on a 6-week trip in Asia and it was the perfect one-bag travel solution for me. It fit in the overhead bin on large international flights and smaller local planes, although I didn’t have it completely stuffed. I love all the internal organization, especially the dedicated shoe pocket. And the exterior stash pocket is great for quick access to a rain jacket or fleece. The shoulder straps and harness are very comfortable on my 5’6” frame and the side handles make the bag easy to lug on/off trains or boats. There are pads for stowing the harness and straps but they are cumbersome so I never ended up using them. This bag is the perfect solution for adventure travel.
review.name: Amazing for One Bag Travel

name: GlobeRider45 Travel Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith I/O ChromaPop Goggles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair of Smith I/Os. My first pair went 8 hard years before the foam started to disintegrate (IMO this is very normal and I was still a huge fan). Instantly replaced with another last year (2022 model). Off the bat something off. The lense change latch felt noticably cheaper and lense changes that had a satisfying click kinda just mushed in. But what ended up being a huge red flag was the strap. There was a sticky line of something like those sticky hand toys for kids you get out of a quarter machine. Just thought "I guess they know what they're doing" and just used it. After the first season no real issues but upon slapping it on my helmet for my 2nd season the sticky goo complete melted. The inside of the lense had a large smear and my also brand new Smith maze helmet was covered everywhere with it. Alcohol gets it off the hard shell but it's still on the ear pads and IMO is unusable. I don't think I'll be going back to Smith anymore, this was lame. Goggles were covered under warranty, helmet was not, my fault for using their goggles I guess? Shipping is not covered for warranties FYI.
review.name: Sticky strap ruins lense and helmet

review.reviewBody: Love my new goggles. Fits my helmet and face perfectly.
review.name: Love my new goggles. Fits

review.reviewBody: These goggles are great inside my sled/moto helmet. The coverage is perfect. I really like both lenses these goggles came with
review.name: These goggles are great inside

review.reviewBody:
Clear, crisp lenses that never fog up or ice over. 
Comfortable fit that integrates nicely with my helmet. 
Smith stands behind their products and has a great customer service team.
review.name: Clear, crisp lenses that never

review.reviewBody:
I bought those I/O goggles, thinking it was a premium high quality product. I have always been extra careful with is, storing it away in its sleeve. This new season, I got it out of the sleeve to find the glue of the foam had disintegrated and messed the whole screen. It's good for the trash.
I contacted Smith who dismissed my claim. You know why ? In the US, it would be covered by the lifetime warranty. But because I am in Europe, a faulty product is not their concern.
What a disappointment for a company that claims a premium positioning.
review.name: The goggles completely disintegrated. Not their problem.

review.reviewBody: The venting was such that wind whipped through the inside of the goggles making my eyes tear. Not only did this impair my vision while skiing, it also meant I had to clean "speed tears" off the inside of the lenses after every single ski day. After my first day I tried to clean the splashes off the inside of the sun lens with the supplied goggle bag, but ended up scuffing the inside of the lens. So now I own expensive Smith goggles that are scuffed and make my eyes water. And after every ski I have to wash them in warm water and mild soap to get them clean. Not super thrilled, though the goggles are comfortable and look great.
review.name: Over vented

review.reviewBody: The I/O model lenses are the best, but after a couple of use, the foam got ripped. What can be done in such case?
review.name: Foam Problem

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed with all of my Smith purchases this season. First I had issues with the mission helmet. Next I went to use these goggles and was shocked at how much worse they had gotten from the ones I had years ago. The lens transition has somehow gotten more challenging and feels extremely cheap. I am not able to return any of my items because I have a prodeal through NSP. I am really disappointed that smith has dropped their quality so much. I will not only be not recommending their gear, I will be actively turning potential shoppers away from their gear. You would think they want to keep workers in the industry satisfied, however it seems they have moved to making cheap gear for a high price point.
review.name: Quality has gone way down

review.reviewBody: I bought these this season and couldn’t be happier, lenses are fantastic and the release system is really easy to use (of course I didn’t read the instructions) really happy with these, great buy!
review.name: Best goggles I’ve ever worn

review.reviewBody:
I have been using the I/O since the very first generation and have several Lenses which have never let me down. Upgraded for the look of the white band this year and picked up the Chrome Pop green lens to go along with my 5 other lenses… the fit is fantastic, no fog at all. I spend the whole day with the lens in through shady and sun… I was amazed by the clarity of the lens in sunny conditions and very quick to adjust through the shade. If you haven’t tried this lens I would decide for your self.

On a side note the goggles comes with a great durable case which has a slot to Carry a second lens in the soft microfibre goggle case, this is a very nice attention to detail. 

If there was a con to the goggles. I would like to see a Smith logo and or lettering on the white strap on both sides for style.
review.name: I/O Reviews

name: I/O ChromaPop Goggles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my husband. He likes them way more than his cotton blend athletic socks.
review.name: Great socks!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have multiple styles and pairs of icebreaker socks. I snagged these on sale and it is a win for me. After trying other merino wool socks I settled on icebreaker. The fit and comfort is better.
review.name: I would buy this style again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the feel and fit of these socks. Perfect thickness. They keep my feet warm even when they get wet. I've ordered them several times and will continue to order them!
review.name: I love your Merino socks!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Shows a lot but if you're wearing with boots they're perfect.
review.name: Comfortable but show too much

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my 2nd time purchasing these socks. They have outlasted similar (merino) brand socks.
review.name: quality socks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They fit great, perfect weight, wash beautifully. (I bought men's because they are blue, couldn't find in women's). Oh, and they were on sale!
review.name: Third time I've purchased these socks.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have tried a dozen pairs of merino wool socks and nothing comes close to the appeal and comfort of these. They are smell resistant (havent smelled bad in a week of wear..) and extremly comfortable. I highly recommend these socks!
review.name: Incredible

review.reviewBody:
I have SRAM G2 "trail" brakes on my XC bike. I'm around 195lbs. I found them a little lacking in stopping power even with sintered pads. I was gonna replace them with code brakes but I decided to try these HS2 rotors. Because they're thicker the bite point seems to be higher in the travel and feels like my code brakes with normal SRAM centerline rotors on my Enduro bike.
Very happy with this purchase/upgrade
review.name: Worth every penny

review.reviewBody: I was stoked to see this rotor improvement from SRAM.  I don't know how they based the increased braking performance but it works as advertised.  I mounted the 220 in the front and 200 in the back.  Besides looking stylish, it's provided a lot more confidence on short, steep descents.  I've yet to try them on a long, steep descent so I can't say anything about brake fade.  We'll see...
review.name: Improved Stopping Power

review.reviewBody:
I put a 220 on my Fox 36 and a 200 in the rear on my Slash 9.8. I run Code RSCs. I am upgrading from the old style Sram rotors, which are quite a bit thinner. The 200 rotor was warped when I got it. Nothing a rotor truing tool couldn't take care of, but I wish it would have been true from the factor. The warping wasn't too bad. The performance is unreal compared to the old style. I had to spend a bit of time really spreading out the pistons to accommodate the thicker rotors per Sram's instruction, but they clear great in the previous generation (Pre 2023) RSCs. 

The stopping power is awesome. A massive improvement. The biggest improvement I noticed though was a huge reduction in brake fade. I went to one of my favorite downhills, hit start on the strava, and went as hard as I could for the 3.24 mile downhill segment. Lots of switchbacks after long rocky straights; great for testing out brake fade. They were flawless. Even with the RSCs, I would get a little brake fade with some whining on this segment towards the end. Hardly any fade at all and not a squeak when the rotors were at their toastiest. The new design is a huge upgrade I would recommend to anyone with RSCs. 

5 Stars. It would be less if I factored in the slightly warped nature of the 200 rotor when I got it, but that is pretty common and a simple fix. My review is solely based on the performance of the rotors.
review.name: Warped, but After Fix = Awesome

review.reviewBody:
Got out on these for the first time this season, and brakes were surging. After troubleshooting and a ultimately getting out the bogey gauge, found that one had a thick spot and the other was pretty warped right out of the box. 

Unfortunately after calling Backcountry, was advised that they don't handle SRAM warranty claims, no returns since it's past 30 days, and I would need to take it up with my local bike shop.

Lesson learned, no more buying bike parts from Backcountry! No support available. Keep it local.
review.name: Warped and no help from Backcountry

review.reviewBody:
Bought 2 220s.  Both were warped right out of the box.  One had about 0.15 of run out.  The other close to 0.10.  Now I have pad drag with brand new pads and rotors even after adjusting calipers, pistons, and bite point.  Not really that stoked to see that with a $70+ rotor brand new out of the box.

Beware if you don't have adjustable bite point.
review.name: Nice but warped right out of the box

review.reviewBody: From SRAM. Have installed these on several bikes now with organic pads (Utah climate) and have had exceptional results. The common sense behind these rotors is nothing more than basic. But the fact that SRAM finally did it makes me happy. I will only be buying these rotors from here on out when it comes to SRAM. Thanks for bringing these in!
review.name: Best Rotor Yet

review.reviewBody: Yes its a metal disc that stops your bike but this is a really good metal disc that REALLY stops your bike.  Upgrade from 200mm to 220mm.  Little to no fade on long downhills.
review.name: Crazy Good Rotor

name: HS2 Rotor - 6-bolt

review.reviewBody: I have a ton of smart wool clothing. This one immediately got a hole in it.
review.name: Love the design and the brand but fail

review.reviewBody: Great fit, style and warmth. Small criticism;  color, in ad, looked more cadmium than the ochre it is.
review.name: Checks all the boxes ☑️☑️☑️

review.reviewBody: Merino wool that can be machine washed and dried is the best. I have a bunch of these for daily wear and love this one with slightly higher weight.
review.name: Love these shirts

review.reviewBody: As always the merino 250 baselayer is consistent with previous purchases. Keeps me warm from Georgoa to Norway. Worth the full price as well.
review.name: Can't go wrong with Smartwool.

review.reviewBody: Perfect base layer to wear under a 3 layer Gore Jacket in winter in the mountains.
review.name: Smartwool Merino 250 base layer

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these in January and skied for six weeks trying various layers to stay warm and still have the best mobility.  The best combo was an under armour short sleeve short, the Smartwool baselayer and a Free Fly Bamboo Heritage fleece.  Even at the coldest temps I was warm.  I bought two more of these Smartwool baselayers.
review.name: Great Baselayer

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a ski week at Big Sky. Love Smartwool and this is no different. Very soft and comfortable. Lightweight but still very warm. Wore it 3 days straight and still no odor. Love it!
review.name: Great base layer

review.reviewBody: I have (2) Smartwool250 base layers.  I use them backcountry backpacking.  In warmer weather I use one for my evening wear/sleeping.  Last year on a cold weather trip I used the second one as a daytime shirt.  They keep me warm and don't pick up odors after a week of backcountry wear.  Love them.
review.name: Great baselayer

review.reviewBody:
Perfect as a pajama top to wear around the house and as a second layer over a snug fitting next to skin layer.
I typically wear a Patagonia capeline mid-weight base layer under a smart wool 250
review.name: Excellent second layer

name: Merino 250 Baselayer Crew - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought these for runs but also for work (I’m a teacher) and they are fantastic. They feel light on the feet but supported and have been great in this UK cold snap - toes don’t get frozen in these!
review.name: Perfect all weather running

review.reviewBody: So far I'm loving them, and the color couldn't be more perfect!
review.name: Ghost 16 GTX

review.reviewBody: These shoes are cozy for winter running. They're warm and (so far) are keeping my feet dry even in 2 inches of slush. I just wish they came in a Wide width. I bought a half-size larger than normal to accommodate my wide foot, but they're still a little snugger than I'd like.
review.name: Snow Daze

review.reviewBody: One of the best shoes I've bought yet!  So very comfortable!
review.name: BEST SHOES

review.reviewBody: good shoe…waterproof top, warmer then normal running shoes.  The cushioning to great. Since we have snow here, it may be more an inside than outside shoe during the winter months.  But if it dry out i love it for fast walks.
review.name: Good dependable shoe

review.reviewBody: I love this shoe. My podiatrist recommended Brooks to me years ago, and I've have a really good one for walking in dry and/or warm weather. It has a great mesh upper. However, I also needed a shoe for walking in cold weather while it's raining. I've now worn this one a few times in rain, and it keeps my feet warm and dry. I only wish it came in wide as I have wide feet and very high arches. However, I solved that problem by buying the next half size up and by rethreading the shoelaces to every other hole so the shoe accommodates my feet.
review.name: Love the shoe!

review.reviewBody: I have owned at least 10 pair of ghosts, this is my first time buying the Gore-Tex version. For some reason, they fit more snug and seem a little small on me. No idea why that would be, the same size I’ve been ordering for years. A little bit frustrated about it.

I am 74 with normal foot and knee issues for my age. These shoes have worked well for me with my own cushioned inserts. As a walking shoe on paved/hard surfaces, they perform well- good support and decent traction. They are great shoes for travel and out and about in the damp fall and winter in the PNW. My second pair with GTX. I needed to order a half size up for a good fit. Recommend.
review.name: Great Travel and Walking Shoe

review.reviewBody: I run a variety of distances from 10k to sprints as conditioning for my main sport, which makes it hard to find shoes that are versatile - these are the closest I've come to finding the perfect pair, they feel stable but still extremely lightweight. I have had arch and ankle problems in the past and so far no issues with these.
review.name: Versatile and lightweight

review.reviewBody: Earlier this year, I bought the Ghost Max, and they are wonderful for the cushioning and stability. I needed a waterproof shoe as we headed into the rainy season, but couldn’t find a waterproof Brooks shoe that had the cushioning of the Ghost Max. I was hopeful, but skeptical when I ordered the Ghost 16 GTX, but I have been very happy with them. The cushioning has been sufficient, and my feet stay nice and dry.
review.name: Great Shoes for Rainy Walks

name: Ghost 16 GTX Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love the quality - feels like a fabric out of the military. A tightly woven twill. Waist feels great, thighs are a little loose/relaxed, which seems nice, but the ankle tapers to an opening that won’t fit over most shoes, forget about boots, even dress boots. The bottoms just bunch up at the top of the shoe. I wanted to try an alternative to the Prana Bridger Jeans which are my go-to’s, but back to the drawing board as I don’t like the look or feel of narrow ankles unless I’m wearing joggers.
review.name: Great quality, but awkward ankle opening

review.reviewBody: This vest is the usual MH excellent quality material and construction. However, there is no drawstring around the bottom to cinch to keep the draft out.  Also it measures almost 1-2 inches shorter than my previously purchased vest.
review.name: MH Quality with design flaws

review.reviewBody: I like this one! It's comfy, and the stretch is nice to have in a vest, the non-stretchy vests I've had from other brands aren't quite as comfy. It's a solid length, not cropped but not awkwardly long.
review.name: Good vest

review.reviewBody: This vest has skimpy insulation. Mountain Hardwear offers two stretchdown vests for men but, as is often the case with MH, only 1 style for women and the insulation is very thin. Also, this vest does not have as much curve. Prior year's styling/shape has been better. And the color.... the blue vest in the images is actually green. Very green. It looks nothing like any of the images.
review.name: Skimpy insulation, no curve and a misrepresented color

review.reviewBody: Was replacing my old (too small) pair of 686 pants but hand to return as too large
review.name: Wanted to love these

review.reviewBody: The pants are great, the only bad thing I have to say is they do run kinda big. For that I'm taking off a star. I'm easily a medium all across (W29in) but I could've gone with a small. Luckily they can adjust from the waist and I ended up keeping them for the baggier look anyway. Other than that I love these pants!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit well, can adjust waist to make them more snug. Great inner layer than can be worn around casually!
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven’t worn them on the slopes yet, but got the jacket and loved it so much I decided to pull the trigger on the pants while they were on sale. They fit very well, are adjustable for comfort, and appear to be great quality!
review.name: I haven’t worn them on

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got these for my daughter, she loves em. Fit great
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: comfy, versatile, very stylish and good fit for cargos. it does run big so probably size down from your normal size if you want a good fit.
review.name: Great value and versatility

review.reviewBody: Gift for my daughter. She loves the adjustable waist and the overall comfort of the 3-in-1. She likes that you can remove the liner and wear them by itself after a long day of boarding.
review.name: Gift for my daughter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these pants in large to replace the same model that I purchased over 5 years ago. This large was huge. I tried the medium when I was in a ski shop to check size and the Medium are somehow too snug in the legs. I don’t have big legs and in Large I could have fit two people in. Not sure what is going on with the sizing, but I had to go with Burton pants. Super disappointing
review.name: Sizing is way off on these pants

review.reviewBody: Wife loves these! Raving about the feel of the liner, waist is spot on, and perfect range of motion from cruising to park laps. Another A+ product
review.name: Spot on!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was in need of a new pair of ski pants for this season and so far I love these pants. I can’t wait to test them out on our ski trip this year. The 3-in-1 is a great idea and they are very comfortable and warm. The inner layer zips to the outer layer which helps to keep all the layers together but also allows you to easily separate them.
review.name: I was in need of

name: Smarty 3-in-1 Cargo Pant - Women's

Looks like Castelli has gotten into the real world now for sizing.  This jersey is extremely well made and finished and fits well in every aspect.  Colors are rich and classic.

review.reviewBody:

It's long and loose enough to wear several layers underneath. I hate to return it, because I love the bright color, but no M is available. 
I gave it 4 starts for sizing only.

review.reviewBody: Tires for bikes are quite expensive right now and some times you have to search for the best posible value, this is the case with these Continental RaceKing. The tires are awesome, nice compound, great thread for the road and also the trails. Very nice looking (looks great on the bike). The only drawback is, if you are mounting the tires to use it tubeless, mine took the use of the air compressor to get it seated on the rims, other tires I used before I only used a floor pump, this is not the case with these ones, so be aware of that before hand. I used it on road and trails and the feeling of the bike is awesome, very fast tire in both terrains.
review.name: Great Tires!!

name: Race King ShieldWall Tire - 29in

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and really comfortable. Really good grip too.
It’s really comfortable
review.name: Vans shoes

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these shoes.  I wear them all the time from running errands, touring and vacationing and going for long walks.  They are not bulky, and they breathe.  They are excellent for travel and have great support all around.  Unfortunately, they are hard to find now.
review.name: Best running around town shoes

review.reviewBody: I love vans ultra range, I have had foot issues etc and they are so comfy but also have some support and structure. The first bright blue ones were amazing, now the colours are so boring and this versions a bit more exciting but does not clarify its fabric with a stretchy fabric part that goes around the ankle/tying area. This is stretchy and loose so these shoes feel loose, socks fall down and can't get a snug fit.  Still comfy but not as good for walking, etc and can't wear as much.
review.name: too stretchy!

review.reviewBody:
These are not very warm and I am very disappointed that after 2 weeks of wear, the sheepskin is worn through to whatever plastic the sheepskin is glued to. So like my head rests on plastic not soft fur. 
I like the style. And I can confirm they are waterproof. They are moderately comfortable. My calves are big and they rub.  So maybe just not best for my body. 
Good experience with this retailer. Fast shipping.
review.name: Just ok

review.reviewBody: The thermal plush bottom makes these even more comfortable than an average pair of blundstones, definitely recommend
review.name: Wardrobe must have

review.reviewBody:
These boots are warm, comfy and very well constructed. Plan to use them for cold winter hikes, even in snow since they are waterproof. They also look great with jeans or a skirt. 
Timeless
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: I hate wearing heavy winter boots during the colds months in Colorado but want to stay warm and dry. These are my first pair of Blundstones and I WILL NOT GO BACK. LOVE LOVE LOVE these boots. They are so comfortable and warm and not ugly like snow boots, so I can wear them to work. Also, Backcountry shipped them to me super duper fast and it was a beautiful experience.
review.name: My favorite pair of boots!

review.reviewBody:
I did everything I could to avoid Blundstones for years, thinking they would disappoint. Why would I want to wear the same expensive boots everyone else has? Well, because the hype is real - they're stellar.

They are comfy right out of the box, no hot spots or blisters after a few hours of walking. They're also unexpectedly lightweight for being thermal grade. The second day, I wore them shoveling in a blizzard and went to an outdoor bonfire, with 6" of snow in 10ºF. Bone dry and cozy warm with one layer of wool socks.  Amazing arch support. Plus, something about their styling makes them look twice as good as other chelsea boots. I've only had them for 2 weeks but am impressed with what I've experienced so far.

The sizing from other reviews was all over the place. I'm usually US 6.5/7 and the 7's have just a little spare room with thinner socks, but fit perfect with thicker cabin socks. I'd say they run slightly large but keep your normal sizing if you want to wear heavy socks with them.
review.name: Holy cow, they live up to the hype!

review.reviewBody: These are everything I wanted but they run a bit small. The length of the boot was fine but the liner causes a very snug on the top. If you?re looking at these, consider at least a half size up.
review.name: Loved these but needed a size up.

review.reviewBody: I ordered a size 5.5 UK and they came in 6.5. The bottom of the shoe said 5.5 but inside the shoe said 6.5 so maybe it was a defective shoe.... I also did not realize there was a fur sole so there should be a description of that before you buy them. I have an original pair of the black Blundstone in 5.5 which I love and wear almost daily, just make sure you get the right size.
review.name: Thermal Boots- Women's

review.reviewBody: I am really glad I bought these boots. I am cold all the time, it's a running joke in my family. I feel comfortable in these in the cold, wet PNW winters. Granted it's not as cold here as in the northeast, but it gets into the 30s and occasionally into the teens. I am very happy with these, they keep looking better with age. Maybe a tad clunky.
review.name: Slower to break in, looking great at 1yr

review.reviewBody: Takes a bit to break in the stiff leather. Once you break them in they are all you would want in an insulated boot. Warm, stylish, and waterproof. Found them to run true to size I'm usually a 7.5 or 8 and the 7.5 fit with a darn tuff wool sock.
review.name: Once you break them in you are golden

review.reviewBody: I found these to be excessively clunky. I liked the fact that they had a Sherpa insert, but  the leather is pretty thin so feet got cold quickly. The top part of the boot is tight on my high arches that I couldn?t wear them for more than a few minutes before I had to take them off.
review.name: Not worth the money.

name: Thermal Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Marmot Tungsten UL Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tungsten UL Tent: 3-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Marmot Tungsten UL Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I got tungsten ul 3p tent last year but couldnt get fly add on

No any distributers, no any retailer, even though I have found all www site..

Pls help me
Actually I never pitched tungsten still,,, as soon as I get fly, I will go out fot enjoying the tent perfectly
review.name: Cannot find hatchback fly discontinued..

review.reviewBody: I have only used this tent once so far but I'm really happy with it. It's really lightweight and easy to assemble. I love the full fly and it kept everything dry in the rain. The vestibules are fairly large and there's plenty of head room inside the tent. I bought a ground sheet separately. That's the only thing I was disappointed about. It didn't come with the tent. But I have a friend who has used this tent for 8 years now and still loves it.
review.name: Fantastic tent

review.reviewBody: Good ventilation fits 3 adults nicely and room at or head for some gear. Seems like a good buy for $300
review.name: Solid tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great tent... can't wait to take it on the first adventure!
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Marmot has amazing customer service. I had an issue and they replaced the well used tent at no cost. This is my favorite 3 season tent - and I own 4 others from high-end manufacturers. Well thought-out, large, fast setup, durable in wind (used in ~50mph). It's my go to below tree line.
review.name: My go to

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We have only used it 3 times but so far so good. Seems tough and it kept the water out. It did well in strong winds.  We haven’t backpacked with it yet. 

My girlfriend, two dogs (60 and 80 lbs), and me (6’1” 200 lbs) all fit inside comfortably.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought this tent for backpack camping. Its for two of us. My husband is over 6 feet so we were worried about getting too small of a tent. The tent is perfect for the two of us plus our gear or our dog. Its lightweight and wasy to split the load.
review.name: Perfect tent for backpacking

review.reviewBody: It's Certainly a light weight tent and big enough for two plus some gear. it's a bug net with floor and two doors and a fly. I just got it and it's too cold to use till next year. I did set it up and it's definitely put together well. If weight is your biggest concern I don't know how they can make it any lighter. The seams are taped, the zippers work good, it's New! Hope I can add to this after I have used it.
review.name: Rating a Tent I have not used...yet

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Still new to this tent, but it performed well on the first two outings.

It is very light.  Excellent room for two and still within a reasonable backpacking weight budget.  I purchased the footprint and recommend you do too.  We split up with 42oz for the body and fly and 34.5oz for the poles, footprint, stakes, guy cord and repair kit.

Fly pitches tightly if you stake out the side between the doors.  The vents are a nice feature however I deducted one star because the reinforcement patch on one of them had unraveling stitches on the second setup.  I will send it in for warranty repair, which I'm sure Marmot will support, but if the repair lead time is long I may fix this myself.

The green strikes me as an odd color - almost faded in the pictures, but in the field it's a pleasant color that blends in well with surroundings without being impossible to see.  The fly has bits of reflective material that serve well to guide you back from a late-night bio break.

Zippers are fine gauge and somewhat fiddly but I had no problem when the tent is pitched tautly.

Setup is quite easy, although I'd strongly prefer if the two main poles were permanently joined at the intersection.  The pole clips seem functional but I expect they would break if I accidentally stepped on one

I have not yet had it out in the rain, but with the fly pitched fully taut I see no reason to get wet inside.  The seam sealing appears to be good quality.  It has ample ventilation with the full mesh tent body.
review.name: Very light, spacious, well designed

review.reviewBody: Backpacking game changer. Don't get me wrong, I still love my Tungsten... but this will be the tent coming with me for long overnights. The weight is insane, & the parts still feel durable. I purchased the 3 person, but typically only use it for 2 people. It's BIG & spacious, which I love. If you want to save a tiiiiny bit of weight, the 2 person is great too. But I personally love more room to sprawl out in a tent!
review.name: Make the Change to Ultralight!!

name: Tungsten UL Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: I wear a medium, my head measures less than 57cm. This helmet is a bit on the small end, it fit snuggly, not too uncomfortable, it did widen after 2 days.
review.name: Decent helmet

review.reviewBody:
Purchased size medium.  My head measures 57 cm.  My prior helmet was a medium K2 Phase and that fit well.  The shape of this helmet seems too round--extremely tight on the front and back of head with gaps on the sides.

Otherwise the helmet seems very nice--it has a nice venting system, fits well with goggles, and the materials are high quality.
review.name: Uncomfortable fit

review.reviewBody: My head measured 56cm and I've always wear size M helmet, but this particular helmet is so tight from mid to top of the helmet. I exchanged for a size L and it was way too big and sit at the eyebrows...a no go for me with a big goggle. I really like the design and quality of this particular helmet, but I had to return.
review.name: way too tight on top

name: Diversion Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I have 5 of these in different colors. Without a doubt my favorite day-to-day shirt. Warm, soft, durable. Not at technical piece obviously, but great for home, office, and town.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Very nicely made and thick. Good for working outside in cold weather.
review.name: Excellent shirt

review.reviewBody: Got this for Christmas. Fine for at home lounging, but there's no point bringing on any outdoor, especially in winter. 100% cotton.
review.name: Cotton?

review.reviewBody: I really loved this shirt, the fit is perfect. It’s soft and heavyweight. However, I wore it on one 2 mile hike and then when I returned I noticed some of the worst pilling I’ve ever seen on a flannel. I have worn many flannels on hikes but none have pulled this severely.
review.name: Amazing shirt, pills terribly after one use

review.reviewBody: I am 6’3 - 170-180 lbs. with a fairly slender build. I rarely leave reviews, but this a great shirt. Bought the medium and the sleeves fall just right on my hands. The material is very soft and heavy weight flannel. 10/10 would buy again. Have some other shirts from the competition and this is the best by far.
review.name: Perfect winter shirt for me

review.reviewBody: I bought the black Plusher a couple of weeks ago.  It is described on the web site as winter weight cotton.  I think it would be more useful to call it winter weight flannel.  The shirt appears to be well made.
review.name: Very good heavy weight flannel shirt

name: Plusher Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: They gave the Ferrosi's an adjustable waist draw chord so you don't have to wear a belt.  Excellent shorts, high quality, nice fit, and feel.
review.name: Excellent Shorts

review.reviewBody: My third pair of Ferosi shorts - they wear well and look great.
review.name: Outstanding product!

review.reviewBody: Outdoor Research Ferrosi Shorts are my go-to shorts for hiking!  They are fantastic for anything from a short day hike to a multi-day trek!  They are lightweight, tough and very comfortable!  They last a long time, which doesn't surprise me because all Outdoor Research products are of the highest quality and dependable!
review.name: Best hiking shorts ever!

review.reviewBody: Great hiking shorts, comfortable, lightweight, and the pockets I need.
review.name: Perfect Hiking Shorts

review.reviewBody: Well constructed and comfortable. Consistent with all OR gear.
review.name: Recommend Ferrosi Shorts

review.reviewBody: The shorts are athletic, but still designed to where anywhere comfortably.  They are my new go to shorts.
review.name: Awesome Feel and Fit

review.reviewBody:
I bought these for a backpacking trip and I’m so happy I did.  They fit a bit snugger in the legs/crotch than my other shorts, and I was initially concerned about that.  But the stretchy material is the key here and they move easily as needed.  It also makes the shorts look better during “normal” use around town because they aren’t so baggy as my other hiking shorts. 

I plan to buy another pair soon.
review.name: Favorite New Hiking Shorts

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts. They're perfect for warm weather. Good for casual outings or hiking and fitness.
review.name: Best Shorts!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable I have been wearing them all the time. They also look really good. I'm convinced the Ferrosi material is the most comfortable, durable, lightest, least restrictive material around for bottoms. Go and get the pants and these shorts now.
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: These shorts are very comfortable, have lots of stretch for mountain scrambling and biking, breathe well, and look good. Unfortunately the material doesn't seem very durable as it's already pilling along the pockets and seat. The front pockets are also too wide and shallow so items easily fall out when seated with a slight angle back (like driving or sitting up in a tent). I have 10-year-old similar shorts from a competing brand that are better in all those respects. These could be great so hopefully they'll improve them in the next design phase but I would not recommend purchasing these now if you plan to use them for a long time like I do with my apparel.
review.name: Comfy but flawed

name: Ferrosi 10in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While looking for a small backpack for my Olympus M43 camera and multiple lenses, the PRVKE 21L bag with camera cube kept coming up in reviews as a great choice. I appreciate that it has both a well padded and highly configurable section for my camera equipment and a large open free space for less sensitive gear. Also, the ability to attach my tripod to the pack really simplifies preparations and hiking. The water resistant materials and well sealed closures are important features to me and have proved their value in just a short time while out in the winter weather. I'm already planning my next purchase of a PRVKE 31L for my larger camera and lenses.
review.name: Great Small Camera Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as a gift for my son. The bag is amazing with compartments for lens & gear. Best of all, bag can handle rain or snow. Really easy to handle & load. By far best camera bag.
review.name: Great Bag for Camera Gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this backpack, the size is perfect and the placement of all the pockets is perfect except the front one, which is hard to open when you have the equally awesome tech bag dangling from it. Still ( stars though
review.name: Fantastic backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son did a ton of comparison research on backpacks and chose this one for his Christmas present. He absolutely loves it and the rest of us do too! Now we each want one. Super cool style and such a specifically engineered, intentional design!! Impressive!
review.name: Love this backpack!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son asked for this backpack for his photo equipment - it is very well made and heavy duty! Very happy with this purchase
review.name: Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Full disclosure, my Gen 1 Prvke broke at the zipper after 4 years of heavy use and travel. Wandrd's lifetime warranty is legit - darn you all! The Gen2 Prvke is improved upon and feels even better.
review.name: V2 even better

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is a game changer, it met every expectation that I had for it. It’s very comfortable for my back, very snug feel. When I’m out in public doing shoots I always get compliments. The compartment are easy to adjust with the interchangeable Velcro padding. 10/10 !
review.name: Bag quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving the bag, very comfortable and able to hold all my camera equipment during my trips.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Wandrd PRVKE series has established itself as a favorite among photographers, travelers, and creatives for its combination of rugged durability, thoughtful design, and stylish aesthetics. The **31-liter PRVKE Backpack** paired with the **Pro Camera Cube** elevates this bag into an excellent choice for those seeking a versatile, camera-focused bag with ample storage and organizational options.---#### **Build Quality and Design**The PRVKE 31L is crafted from **weather-resistant tarpaulin and ballistic nylon**, ensuring durability and protection against the elements. The bag exudes a modern, minimalist aesthetic that appeals to urban explorers and outdoor adventurers alike. Key design elements include:- **Magnetic Tote Handles:** For quick grab-and-go functionality.- **Weatherproof Zippers:** Offer additional protection for gear in inclement weather.- **Expandable Roll Top:** Adds up to 5 liters of extra storage, taking the capacity to 36 liters.The **build quality is outstanding**, with reinforced stitching and robust materials that can handle heavy loads without showing signs of wear.---#### **Comfort and Fit**The PRVKE 31L offers a comfortable carrying experience thanks to its **padded shoulder straps and back panel**. The bag includes an adjustable chest strap, which helps distribute weight evenly. However, users carrying heavy loads for extended periods may notice the absence of a hip belt, which could alleviate pressure on the shoulders.---#### **Storage and Organization**This backpack is incredibly well-organized, catering specifically to photographers and content creators:1. **Pro Camera Cube**: - The Pro Camera Cube is tailored to fit snugly within the main compartment of the PRVKE, providing padded and customizable dividers for gear. - It easily accommodates a **full-frame DSLR or mirrorless camera, along with 3–4 lenses** and additional accessories. - The cube is removable, allowing the bag to transition seamlessly between a photography bag and a regular travel bag.2. **Dedicated Laptop Sleeve**: - Fits laptops up to 16 inches, with padding for protection. - Also includes a tablet sleeve for added utility.3. **Quick-Access Side Pocket**: - Enables fast retrieval of the camera without fully opening the bag.4. **Expandable Roll Top**: - Great for carrying extra clothing or gear for longer trips.5. **Multiple External Pockets**: - Zippered front pockets for small items. - A hidden passport pocket for secure storage of valuables.---#### **Functionality for Photographers**Photographers will appreciate the **side camera access**, allowing quick and discreet access to their camera. The inclusion of the **Pro Camera Cube** ensures gear stays protected and organized. There are attachment points for tripods, and the roll-top design makes it easy to expand storage when carrying additional items like jackets or food.---#### **Versatility**The PRVKE 31L shines as a **multifunctional bag**, transitioning effortlessly from a camera bag to a general-use travel bag. By removing the camera cube, the main compartment transforms into a spacious cavity suitable for clothes, books, or groceries.---#### **Cons**While the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is an excellent option, there are some minor drawbacks:- **Lack of Hip Belt:** Carrying heavy gear over long periods could be more comfortable with a dedicated hip belt.- **Weight:** At 3.4 lbs (1.5 kg) without gear, the bag is on the heavier side due to its durable materials.- **Limited External Accessory Straps:** While there are attachment points, more robust strap options for larger items would be helpful.---#### **Price and Value**At a premium price point, the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube offers excellent value for photographers who prioritize durability, organization, and style. While there are cheaper options, few can match the quality and versatility of this bag.---#### **Conclusion**The Wandrd PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is a **top-tier backpack** for photographers and travelers seeking a stylish, durable, and functional solution. Its ability to adapt between camera and travel modes, combined with its weatherproof construction and thoughtful design, makes it a standout option. Despite minor drawbacks, it remains a worthwhile investment for those serious about protecting and organizing their gear.**Rating: 9/10** **Best For:** Photographers, urban explorers, and travelers needing a versatile and durable backpack.
review.name: Review of the Wandrd 31 Liter PRVKE with Pro Camera Cube

review.name: Momentum 4s Harness

review.reviewBody: Really don't like this harness. Makes me miss my older BD so much. The leg buckles are very difficult to adjust and the harness has a plastic feel to it. Also, the lack of a rear haul line is always disappointing. Planning to return this item.
review.name: Buckles hard to adjust

review.reviewBody: I enjoy having the large degree of adjustability. I can loan it to any of my friends with varying body types and all of them can use it just as well. It is plenty comfortable for sport climbing and would be fine for trad as long as you won't need to hang for a super long time. I found I could sit in it for about 15-20 minutes before I had any issues. Overall, I think this is a really great harness for beginners with a wide range of applications that eliminates most of the guesswork surrounding harness sizing. I would reccommend the Momentum 4s for sure!
review.name: Epic harness!

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned several of these over the years. High Quality. Durable for its features and materials. I’ll probably keep buying.
review.name: Super simple high quality harness

review.reviewBody: Great beginner harness for gym climbing. Step right in and with a few quick adjustments, you’re ready to go. Padding seems great. No complaints at all. Thanks BD.
review.name: Great beginner harness, comfortable and adjustable

review.reviewBody: I bought the L / XL version of this harness. I have a 33” waist but feel as though this harness fits me well. I have used this only in the climbing gym but really like the fit and comfort it provides.
review.name: Comfortable and adjustable harness

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I got the large and I have a 32” waist but larger legs. You will need a large if you fit this category.
review.name: Very comfortable. I got the

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable harness. Very easy to use. Extremely lightweight.
review.name: Great Harness

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a couple harnesses so far, and this is by far my favorite. Very lightweight and comfortable.
review.name: Favorite Harness Yet

review.reviewBody: Great comfy, material & craftsmanship, but the waist on the size 4, 30 inch leg was just a snug enough fit to be uncomfortable & I have a trim mid-section. C/be due to fastening w/only one button vs 2?  I have to return them & went w/Prana Halle ii instead
review.name: Needs bit wider waist

review.reviewBody: I love the flattering fit and flexibility of these pants. They are light and breathable, which is a must for the hot, humid summers where I live. I have a hard time finding the right fit in pants, but I have zero complaints about these. Would love to see more colors!
review.name: Favorite hiking pants!

review.reviewBody: These pants are awesome! I went off reviews and got the perfect size! My wife is  5? 6? and 140lbs and I got a 8x32! The air flow on these are unreal, awesome for hiking in the heat cause they fold up and snap as well!
review.name: Breezy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I updated to this pad for casual camping, backpacking and cycle touring so wanted something that was light, durable but with the highest level of comfort. All of these features exist without compromise.
review.name: Sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Went camping and had to set up last minute on the flattest area I could find, on the side of a gravel road. It barely supports your weight, so the moment you lay up right you will hit bottom. I do love sea to summit products but this was a miss for me.
review.name: Doesn’t handle gravel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The engineering on this thins is great. The integrated inflation sack and dual action port work great and make for quick inflation and deflation. Pack size is just right and weight is truly UL. I used it in conjunction with a top quilt and was comfortable down to 35 degrees F. Minimal movement squeaking. I would recommend for all your 3 season needs.
review.name: Great Pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I switched to this pad from the neo air uberlite because of punctures and night time deflation. The sea to summit pad is much more durable and being insulated doesn't deflate at night, highly recommended
review.name: Great sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely love the pad, light and warm. When it inevitably got some small holes, the S2S people helped a ton.
review.name: Great Pad with Great Warranty

review.reviewBody: I have a women's regular insulated mat. The good: Blows up quickly, deflates to fold easily, lightweight, and if it held air would be comfy. This is my second mat both with similar problems: they lose air as the night goes on so that I'm sleeping in the middle of the night on a 1/2 full pad. Very uncomfortable. The first one I looked and looked for a leak, then sent back to the company who said there was no leak after testing. I asked to please send another one. They did and the same problem is occurring, whether at high altitudes (which they said might happen and you have to re-blow it up) or in the desert. Unfortunately, I'm done with this mat.
review.name: Loses air

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used it when I went on the Kalalau trail. Excellent product and lite weight.
review.name: Excellent Product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The mattress is reasonably light, comfortable and durable. The inflation bag is much nicer than blowing into a mattress. I'm both a super sleeper and a back sleeper. The mattress is more comfortable laying on my back but fine on my side.
review.name: Good mattress

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this pad and pillow on two multi day solo trips in Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness. Great comfort and support PLUS minimal crackling noise. I’m a side sleeper and this pad keeps me centered.
review.name: Great system with low weight!

review.reviewBody: The weight of the pad only is 13.2oz, not 12.3 as advertised.
review.name: Good pad, wrong weight

name: Ultralight Insulated Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Gravity Cap Computer Mount for Garmin

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
++Excellent water resistance
++Lightweight design
+Outstanding grip
+Sufficient flexibility for B1

--Lacks a rear heel welt for compatibility with semi-automatic crampons which I had assumed when making the purchase
review.name: fantastic summer alpine boot but missing semi auto crampon compatibility

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. I use them for snowmaking. Not a very warm boot. The leather does get wet but feet stay dry. Very supportive and light weight.

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Mammut has become the only boot I buy.  Good out of the box comfort.   Nice stiff boot while comfortable enough for everyday use.
review.name: Continued great quality from Mammut

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are great boots. On my third pair of them. I use them for work, hunting and backpacking so they get a ton of use in all kinds of conditions.

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable. No blisters with Darn Tough socks on my Himalaya trek. Lukla-> Namche-> EBC -> Kalapathar -> Gokyo Ri -> Namche -> Lukla +Kathmandu
Sometimes wear them casually, I'm Coloradan. Theyre kinda stiff but with the DT socks I enjoy feeling "prepared". \m/

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the sturdiness of the boots, but they'll need some break in time as they're not ad maliable as other softer sole boots are. These were purchased for hiking in the mountains up rugged, uneven, often sharp surfaces so I'm liking them.
review.name: They need some break in time

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I read to order a half size larger than one would typically wear, so I ordered a US11 and the fit is bang on. Light weight, low profile, and feels "accurate". I use them for hiking, chainsaw work, and rope rescue. I've used similar Scarpa and La Sportiva boots for the same applications, these are lighter weight and so far I've found no weaknesses. Would recommend.
review.name: Kento Tour High GTX review

review.itemreviewed: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Used as a general purpose winter boot. Don't buy if you're looking for a hiking boot. Very warm (10¬∫F), stiff and supportive. Love the heel cup and high traction sole. Lacing with multiple hooks is nice. Unfortunately, fits very large. I ordered the same size as my Mammut hiking boots but I probably could have gone down a whole size. Not sure if this is intentional to accommodate multiple pairs of socks, but you probably don't need them since the boots are so warm!
review.name: Super supportive

name: Kento Tour High GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coalition Snow Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: The lil nasties are such a fun ski! They are so responsive and playful, I can’t get enough! I ride the 166 SOS but demoed the 173 and I loved having a bit of extra length. These skis are super easy to turn and have so much pep in their step 🤩

review.itemreviewed: Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: As an avid backcountry skier the Lil Nasty was a pivot adoption for more time in the resort and did not disappoint.  Smaller under foot ( 94) allowed for quicker and faster turns on fresh, firm and steep groomers.  The moderate stiffness was playful but firm enough to be able to ski fast and trust each turn in reliable and variable conditions.  It is a true "little sister" to Coalition's award winning all mountain SOS ski.  The  next gen All Mountain ski to keep it easy but ski hard.  She even floats in POW.  Enjoy.
review.name: Lil Nasty Sweet Surprise

review.itemreviewed: Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm ABSOLUTELY OBSESSED with the Lil' Nasty, she's an all mountain ripper. I demoed the 173 from Coalition Snow last year and at first was a little nervous because I usually ski a 164-168. But as soon as I got on snow with this ski, I was blown away by the quick turning radius and the ability to make quick maneuvers like jump turns in steep chutes or moguls. I also loved the 94 underfoot waist, giving me the ability to still lay into some carves on groomers, but still being able to play in some soft snow on those dust on crust kind of days.
review.name: Definitely a snack!

name: Lil' Honey Yum Baby Cakes Nasty Snack Ski - 2025 - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this in purple and was thrilled to find it on sale in the yellow. It’s lightweight and just enough fabric for those days when a shirt alone isn’t enough but something heavier is too much. Good length on the sleeves, pockets in front and fits well.
review.name: Great warmer weather jacket

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: My new fave jacket. Perfect for summer hiking in the Bay Area. Great color, love the fit. I already have it in two colors.
review.name: Great for summer activities!

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very lightweight. Perfect for when you’re concerned short sleeves aren’t enough. Wish there was a front inside pocket … it’s on the side / back.
review.name: Perfect … inside pocket?

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great light weight easy to stuff in my pack. Material has a little give, just wish it ordered it with a hood.
review.name: great lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I now have this jacket in both the standard and hooded style, and one of them is always in my pack! Great three-season option for summits and now my go-to outer layer for ascending during winter hikes. The wind resistance provides warmth without weight and has better breathability than a shell to keep me from overheating. Excellent piece of gear.
review.name: My 2nd Airshell Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great jacket   I wore it a few times while bicycling. It’s very light but offers quite good protection against wind and cold. So far I really like it. I usually wear medium sized and that’s what I ordered. Fits a little loose but not too big.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have had this jacket for awhile…. I love it as much today as I did the day I bought it… 
It is pretty rugged considering it is so light!!! 
I love it so much I bought one for my sister, and my mom…. My sister loves hers she lives on a catamaran most of the year.
review.name: Great light jacket

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Couldn't believe my luck with this jacket...I was looking for a replacement jacket to wear while running and this meets all my standards. It's lightweight, fits perfect to size (purchased S and I usually wear S in most brands), and it's bright so I will be seen during darker months.
review.name: A great fit

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This has become my new favorite layer. It's the jacket you didn't know you needed. I've worn it around town on my bike, and it takes the chill off when the temps dip. I've also worn it mountain biking and it's been great. It breaths but also keeps you comfortable when the air is chilly or the wind picks up, it also was great in the light rain the other day, keeping me dry.
review.name: New fave

review.itemreviewed: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been sporting a Brand P wind shirt for years. It is really light, but it also has a hood and no pockets. I don't like hoods and I love pockets, but didn't want to add too many grams. Enter the Kor AirShell. I LOVE this wind shirt. Lightweight, soft, pockets, stretchy on the sleeves and bottom hem. I've been wearing this over a light synthetic jacket for active winter activity and it is perfect. It packs down small enough that it will live in my day pack. And, I might even start bringing it on thru hikes and leave the Brand P behind.
review.name: Fantastic wind shirt for active adventure.

name: Kor AirShell Full-Zip Wind Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, purchased two sizes larger than the suggested, because the Smalls were uncomfortably tight
review.name: Pads disappear

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody: For going under MTB shorts, I've never tried anything better. Very comfortable.
review.name: Not sure how they could be better

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have several pairs of the gen 1 trail liners and trail liner knickers.  They’re better than anything else on the market.  These new gen 2 liners are even better.  The material is thinner and the pockets easier to get to.  I’m not sure the pad changed but the gen 1 pad was perfect so no need to change.  I also appreciate that Assos finally started selling the bib liners with the pictured hip protection instead of making you buy this separate.

Not sure why some reviewers are complaining about the seams… these are liners meant to be worn under shorts, not as standalone.
review.name: Ever better than gen 1

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Fit, comfort and finish of the bids and of the chamois is great , as you would expect if you are familiar with ASSOS (probably from road biking).

The very nice airy mesh keeps you cool when wearing liner + baggy shorts.
 
Fantastic padding on the upper thighs (greater trochanter): large coverage, removable, well vented and  thin, super flexible and comfortable, but still CE rated impact protection, so you know it will actually do something.
This protection pad (HP T3) is much better than the older style used in the ‘plain’ liner shorts/bibs.
There is ZERO reason not to wear thigh protection with these.

Storage pockets are another near must have for me, since my bike has in frame storage and a toptube bag, so a really don’t need a pack, just a few pockets on the longest days.

The one big miss, not unique to Assos, but to all padded shorts/bibs:

NO PADDING ON THE HIP BONE (iliac crest) !

Similarly, a protection pad over the sacrum would also be very useful.

With a pad this flexible, vented and thin, adding some of that  would complete coverage of your mid body, with no downsides.

Plus, if you didn’t want it, you could always remove it.
review.name: Almost perfect,

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm not sure which they put a seam in the front center. I wish they would use the chamois and Koo Koo penthouse from the Cento in these. I do like them, but they could be better.
review.name: Camel toe

review.itemreviewed: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Assos is well known for its road kit. Many people consider them to have the best chamois on the market and they put a huge emphasis on the technical features of their products. Assos poured all of that knowledge and experience into making a liner bib ready for getting rowdy in the dirt and it shows. The fit is a little more relaxed than the typical compression you get from their road bibs and shorts. But the construction and fit do a great job of keeping the chamois in the right spot no matter how much you're moving around on the bike. The chamois feels just like the one used on their Equipe RS bibs. Super breathable, supportive, and keeps you going for long days on the trail. Paired with the mesh construction of the shorts, these liner bibs feel airy underneath my shell shorts. The added pockets on the lower back are nice if you're wearing a Tech-T to give you a place for some nutrition and minimal trail tools. I don't end up using them, but the tabs on the pockets make the openings easy to find if you need them. The last thing I love about these is the added hip protection. The pads aren't felt at all on the ride but are just enough to protect you when taking an unexpected dive into the dirt. I personally *tested* this feature yesterday. :P The leg grippers also work well with helping keep knee pads in place. So, let it be known, Assos is not just for the road set. They knocked it out of the park on these trail liner bibs!
review.name: Top tier Roadie bibs for shredding

name: TRAIL TACTICA Liner Bib Shorts HP T3 - Men's

review.reviewBody:
After going kayak camping a few times, I realized it is good to have some smaller bags that fit inside the storage area of the boat.  You can't fit too many XL dry bags on a kayak!   I have several Sea to Summit Big River Dry Bags, which are my favorite, and I have a very cheap no-name bag...which sometimes leaks...  so I figured I'd try this bag because of the size and price.  

It is a decent bag with quality above the level of "cheap" but not quite at the sturdy thick fabric level of the Sea to Summit Big River bags (which cost more).

This bag is waterproof and has the common three roll down and latch top.  It looks nice and resists getting muddy.  I got the 20 L size.  It is described as admiral gray but I find it to be black.  The 20 L size is good for stuff like sweaters.  You could maybe fit a summer weight sleeping bag inside or a tent and tarp, etc.   I like that it fits into my kayak compartment, which is not a big opening.  

No complaints really except that I guess some people would say the fabric is not super durable.  I have not pushed it to extremes so for me it is fine.  I would recommend getting top quality dry bags but if you want a few extra then this one is alright.  I know it isn't an exciting review but that is how the bag is - just decent but not amazing.
review.name: Decent bag Good size

name: Bluewater 5L-35L Roll Top Dry Bag

review.reviewBody:
My trial of these shoes has been limited by winter but I wanted to give initial impressions.

Fit - These run true to size but are not roomy. I wear a 9-9.5 and 9.5 is comfortable. They're certainly secure with the added velcro tab and cat's tongue material at the heel.

Performance - No complaints on grip, we'll see how durable the tread is. They feel fairly stiff with thick soles - I prefer a lower profile feel but these should stand up to harder rider better than some other shoes I've tried. It's not very ventilated.

Quality & Durability - No comments on durability yet. Quality looks good, for the most part, the stitching seems decent. The velcro tab is fairly thin and seems like it wouldn't take much abuse. The insole is real nice.

Aesthetics - Average. I like color options besides black although the ones offered here aren't really my style. It's a pretty classic mtb shoe silhouette.
review.name: First Impressions - Seems Solid

review.reviewBody: Great shoe once it breaks in (about 3-4 rides).  Not as sticky as 5-10 but easier to reposition foot.  Sole is more durable and much better for hike a bike.  Great protection.  A bit hot but works great for my riding in Juneau AK.
review.name: Great mtn bike shoe!

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are incredibly, delightfully cute and I get many compliments when I wear them. The sole feels really cushiony yet supportive and I love the way it facilitates a fluid heal-to-toe movement when I'm walking. However, it has such a strange and vexing construction. It's basically an open-air skeleton constructed around an interior sock of sorts, so when you're putting on the shoe you really have to get a good grip on the sock so it stays taut and in proper position around your foot. 90% of the time when I put on these shoes my socks get bunched up around my ankles from the sheer amount of friction is takes to get my foot in there. I could always loosen the laces and then re-tighten them once my feet are comfortably in there but no matter how you slice it, it's an adventure to get these things on and fitting properly.

Lastly, I've seen a lot of comments on these running large so I ordered an 8.5 where I normally go for an 8, and there's quite a bit of space around my big toe.

Overall, while these feel and look great while on the move, they're logistically challenging and I would argue, not worth what they cost.
review.name: Not quite worth it?

name: Aura 130 Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love the vibrant colors on these shoes. I had to switch out the laces to Lock Laces so they stay tight all day and can't come untied. I am a professional caddie so I'm walking in dew most mornings and these shoes keep most of the moisture out.

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these for my trip to Ireland and they were awesome. They're snugger in the toe area than my Bondis (more like my Clifton's) and I feared discomfort but it wasn't there. Solid on loose rocky terrain. Repelled what little water I encountered. Comfortable all day long. A traveler from the States wearing Bondis asked me about them on the streets of Dingle and I gave him the thumbs up.
review.name: Just super

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First time Hoka buyer of this model in Men's and one for Woman's for my girlfriend. I've worn New Balance for 20+ years and my GF has worn Brooks for 10+ years. We decided to try this model on to see what the hype was all about. Initially, we loved them instantly! I occasionally wear them to work in a medical setting and my GF wore it daily while bartending. We both liked the fit, color we chose, being Goretex and being comfortable. After 10 months, my Challenger 7 GTX started to tear on top of the shoe, in the crease where I flex my toes. Her's started to do the same in 5 months plus her treaded soles started to come apart!! We haven't even worn them in a rugged trail. It's upsetting because we hoped it would last longer. I reached out to Customer support and we are returning them for a refund and and exchange for my GF. Crossing our fingers that her exchange of the same shoe will be a better experience. The did not have mine in stock anymore. This review would not allow me to post any photos I took to show you how they aren't holding up as they should. I really liked the pair I had too.
review.name: Challenger 7 GTX seems to be Challenged.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful color for outside. Size is good for both kids and adults. Packets up easily to transport from campfire to campfire. Love the quality of these blankets.
review.name: Outdoor favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the perfect outdoor blanket. It’s toasty warm and the perfect size. I bought two so I wouldn’t have to share. My grandson loves to use his when making s’mores over the campfire.
review.name: Great addition to my collection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not only is it great for around the campfire, but its small size makes it perfect for on flights when the AC is cranked. This, plus a stuffable rumpl pillow ensured I (for the first time ever) got some sleep on a red eye.
review.name: Probably my favourite rumpl product!

hasVariant.name: Trail Pro Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Trail Pro Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Mine delaminated just like other reviewers have mentioned. So far ThermARest has failed to ship me a replacement under warranty as promised. Lame.
review.name: Garbage.

review.reviewBody: My pad delaminated and became unusable. Therm-a-Rest said they would replace it under warranty and has yet to send me a new pad. It's been a month and half. I have provided them with all info and photos they requested yet they continue to ignore my inquires into the status of the replacement.
review.name: Garbage product, garbage company.

review.reviewBody:
I love my Therm-a-Rest trail pro! It stayed inflated all night long, was easy to inflate and deflate, packs down to a manageable size, and did its job as advertised.
Would recommend!
review.name: Comfortable Night of Sleep!

review.reviewBody:
I used to have a thermarest trail lite that was to thin and not suitable for a side sleeper like me. 
I still own a thermarest neoair camper that i like because its compact but even at 3 inches thick it fells like a balloon and it offers a good night sleep but not great. 
Finally since I do mostly motorcycle camping and space was limited but i really wanted something similar to the trail lite with foam inside but thicker. I opted for the trail pro. It checks all the right boxes. Not to noisy when moving on it, 3 inch of thickness, as small as a self inflating pad can be, well insulated and finally soft to the touch since i use a quilt. 
I can sleep as well on this pad as in my bed and part of that is also because of the Compressible Pillow Cinch that i really really love.
review.name: the best sleep while camping.

review.reviewBody:
I have one (Large) since around 12? years and used it in rough environment, long horse trips in Mongolia, on camp tours and with hiking. Never had a problem. Never lost air. Always comfortable and warm. One hint against slipping on a tent floor - use a thin, (2-3mm) small Evazote below and there are no problems any more. Same quality but thicker for deep winter tours would be welcome, but I already used it down to -10°C w/o problems.
Slightly higher weight and packing than Pro lite, but worth in colder environments.
Please, keep this quality!
review.name: Solid, warm - and I sleep better than in my bed.

review.reviewBody: I just bought the regular-size TrailPro pad, and I like it a lot. For years I used a Thermarest Classic pad in hip length. I just put a stuff sack of clothes or something under my knees to raise my legs, and the smaller pad was perfectly adequate. This new pad has muych thicker foam and promises to be much more comfortable, but why is there no hip-length version available? I neither need nor want a full-length pad, and the hip length would save weight without sacrificing comfort. It would also be nice if there were a field repair kid for this pad. Not sure why they can't provide one- the old Thermarest Classic was also a knit fabric, and it came with a repair kit.
review.name: Why not a hip-length version?

review.reviewBody: Habe diese Isomatte schon 5Jahre im Einsatz. Exzrem Komfortabel und kleines Packmaß. Leider ist sie nach 5Jahren kaputt gegangen aber Thermarest hat Kostenlos mir eine neue Isomatte geschickt.
review.name: Jonathan

review.reviewBody: I have the regular wide and while it doesn't pack down the smallest, it is extremely warm and comfortable.
review.name: I have the regular wide

review.reviewBody:
After two weeks if use the mattress delaminated and a big air bubble developed. The warranty process went smooth and I received a replacement. 
The new mattress developed the same problem after about a month of use. (I am releasing the air during the day to avoid overpressure to build up)

Yes the mattress is very comfortable but I am travelling at the moment in Africa and can not get a replacement. 

Over all I am not happy with the product which I bought less than half a year ago and already twice the same problem appeared
review.name: This mattress systematically delaminates due to technical design fault.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the mattress early this summer. After 2 weeks it started to delaminate and an air bubble developed. The mattress was replaced without any discussion but also the new Mattress has now developed the same problem. Taking into account that I am now traveling in Africa and only returning in about a month, the situation is pretty frustrating.
I have been handling the mattress correctly and releasing the air during the day as to avoid heat creating overpressure.
review.name: Systematic problems with delamination

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I sized half a size up as I have flat feet and they feel great. I have had these shoes for months now and I really enjoy them. They are easy to clean and are somewhat comfortable, I’m sure with a different insole they would be much better. Even with the insole they come with they are easy on your feet. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great versatile, low-key show.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Paid full price at my local shop for these thinking they would last at least a couple years. I only wore them in the rain. I live in a generally dry climate, and they lasted 4 months! They developed cracks near the toe. No long water proof.
review.name: Terrible quality
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
