review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have owned multiple pairs of the XA Pro 3D. Always willing to pay the higher price for the quality, fit and enjoyment.  I had a pair in reserve I just started wearing, so they fall out of the warranty window and there is no way to connect about the issue. The shoes have separated at the toe cap and the opposite side upper is pulling away from the sole.  I no longer recommend this product and very disappointed.
review.name: Sadly -Poor Quality
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wanted wide fit, comfortable, robust, waterproof shoes.  This model was well recommended, and I was willing to put up with the Quicklace.
The wide fit is comfortable, the shoe looks good and seems robust.  A good start.
But within a week of delivery, I had my first wet day walk and got wet feet.  My socks were still dry around my ankles, so it wasn’t that water was getting in at the top.  Water was coming in somewhere in the body of the shoes, but I could see no obvious damage, so nothing to show in a photo if I complained.  Disappointing.  
I said I was willing to put up with the Quicklace. Presumably fitted for the young buyer who never mastered tying laces.  So now I have the choice of letting the cord flap around annoyingly as I walk, or fiddling with it longer than it would take to tie a lace, to secure it to the shoe.  
Good shoes spoiled by poor manufacture and marketing gimmicks.
review.name: Would be a great shoe if they got it right.
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear of this unfortunate occurrence. All of our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. We ask that you contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link here: https://www.salomon.com/contact

review.reviewBody: After a month use on grass paths walking with my dog there are holes in upper mesh and sole came off. They are not waterproof, goretex these days is a joke. I had speedcross 3 gtx, you could stand in water with them without getting wet. You can see on the picture from the bottom they are brand new coz I didn't wear them much.. very bad quality, sad.. I like design
review.name: Bad quality
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

name: XA Pro 3D V9 Wide Gore-Tex Trail Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Garmin Varia UT800 Smart Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Varia UT800 Smart Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Varia UT800 Smart Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Varia UT800 Smart Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Varia UT800 Smart Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
So far this is the best headlight I’ve used on my road bike, The night flash mode is especially helpful, as I ride mostly in the early pre-dawn.
In combination with my Varia taillight and Garmin 1030, this light is a keeper.
review.name: Working As Advertised

review.reviewBody: Smart features and function with Garmin devices works great. Easy to setup and managed through my 530 Edge, and I light the integrated mount feature. However, this isn't the light for you if you're planning to put in extended hours on the bike in the early morning or late evening. The light has died on the two ~30 mile morning rides I've used it, leaving me with little to no visibility. Unfortunately returning for a non-Garmin integrated light.
review.name: Great function. Limited life.

review.reviewBody: Been using over a month now and no issues. battery life is great. I have it on the auto setting and it works like a champ. recommend it for sure!!!
review.name: Awesome LED light
comment:
Marcel,

Have you used it to do any MTB'ing? I am curious to know if it will light up the trails correctly.

Thanks.

review.reviewBody:
My weekday training rides are done pre-dawn most days, so I need a good light.  I've used Nite-Rider and Light & Motion over the years happily.  Then I bought a Cannondale SystemSix, with bespoke aero bars. There is no place to mount a light except the bottom of the computer bracket.  So I ordered the UT800.  
It twists on and off in just a second, never shifts or slips, and can easily be moved to our tandem.  It provides plenty of light to see and be seen.  Running it one step below full power I get 2-3 hours of steady use or in blink mode during the day I get more.  
So why not 5 stars?  I tried it in paired mode with my 520 twice, then unpaired it.  At 15 mph it switches to full brightness, which gobbles up battery life.  Then the second day I had it paired it decided it only wanted to blink.  It didn't care what I wanted.  So I unpaired it and went back to manual mode, which works great.  The only problem is that there is no way to know how much battery life is left, so I just charge it after every couple of rides and don't worry about it.
review.name: Great Light for My Needs
comment:
Carl, 
My light uses the Garmin to tell me the battery life left in it! Just have to toggle between pages.

review.reviewBody: Even though I read the reviews I decided to buy this light. Mostly for winter riding or riding in places like the Blue Ridge Parkway that have tunnels that have no lighting. Well the reviews that state "Short Battery Life" are true. I used it 22 miles on a Saturday...and then on the next ride... at 15 miles... I received a Low Battery warning. ALREADY!  I was running it connected to my 520 plus so it could do it`s thing. It`s lighting capabilities are impressive... But if it is only good for maybe a 50 mile ride... this light is worthless....!
review.name: Garmin Varia UT 800 first impression

review.reviewBody: I own a garmin computer and this light syncs with it so it knows how fast I'm going and light brightness changes with the speed. If I stop it also stops working until I move again. I like the safety aspect of having 800 lumens let drivers know I'm coming specially during the day. Since I bought the first light I have purchased 3 more for family members. Very pleased with it.
review.name: Perfect Light
comment: What is the longest distance you have been able to ride with the light on?

name: Varia UT800 Smart Headlight

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Roswheel top tube bag for my 58cm Carver All Road gravel bike.  Out of the box I loved the overall design and execution.  The materials seemed first rate and the mounting configuration and high quality straps were equally impressive.  No opportunity to test waterproofness, but from looks alone I would have full confidence the bag would keep my items dry.  Unfortunately, there is a big "however."  The bag was just too long for my frame and I had to return.  I know bikes vary enormously in frame geometry and dimensions, but I was still surprised the bag was too large for a 58cm gravel frame.
review.name: Great Design, However...

Buy the Asolo Fugitive GORE-TEX Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fugitive GORE-TEX Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Asolo Fugitive GORE-TEX Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been testing these boots in the cascades scrambling some tough ground. Comfortable for hard miles. Dry and warm.
review.name: Stompers

review.reviewBody: As soon as I got them I went on a ten mile strenuous rocky hike near Boulder, My feet were very comfortable, no damage, and they have great grip and support. These are excellent shoes with excellent support and grip, and they are lightweight too.
review.name: Ready out of the box

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of the Asolo Fugitive boots.  They fit my feet far better than any of the other dozen pair that I tried on (both 10 years ago and last month).  They are much stiffer than the other boots, which is a plus for my arthritic feet.
review.name: Great & Stiff

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots to walk the 4th round of the 2024 Masters tournament, 29000 steps later, the boots came through perfectly.
review.name: Asolo fugitive gore Tex boot

review.reviewBody: Fits exactly how you would expect it to. Get up To An Extra 20% OFF discount from: promo1024.com
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: I had my boots for three years.  Ended up having multiple spine surgeries so only did mild walking.  Went to put them on recently and, I am not kidding, the spongy part of the sole had literally disintegrated- vanished!  The very bottom part of the sole the rubber part) is flopping around being held on to the upper part of the shoe by the few parts of the spongy part that is still there.  A LOT of money for shoes that have a built in self destruction even when not used for hiking!
review.name: Felt comfy but disintegrated!

review.reviewBody:
I've had these for a few years with ~100 miles on them. Didn't wear them as much as anticipated therefore they sat in the basement. The heel started to de-laminate from the foam. There is no way to fix this as the foam is disintegrating. 

They are burly stiff boots that should last a lifetime but have some qulairty issues.
review.name: Sole de-laminate issue

review.reviewBody:
I have had these boots for around 10-11 years and definitely put them through the wringer. These are my hiking and backpacking boots, they have served me in the Appalachians, the desert, and on the West Coast. They have never failed, the sole is still intact and firmly attached, and they still handle water very well.

They are pretty tight in the toe box. I will consider replacing them with the wide version of the same boot.
review.name: Solid but Narrow

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing Asolo boots for over 40 years, and this style and its predecessors for over 15 years. My foot has grown during that time from 11 to 12 and my fit has always been perfect. No blisters ever. I used to reserve them for hiking and backpacking but now wear them daily as a cure for my once severe plantar fasciitis. They are lightweight, extremely, stable, and provide excellent support to prevent twisted ankles. Exceptional durability, high traction Vibram soles, and Gore-tex lining complete the package.
review.name: Best Hiking Boot ever

review.reviewBody:
I have had the same boot for 11yrs and I would dare to say in upwards to 300miles hiking, walking with the boyscouts... hot and cold weather... a boot that has not failed...I finally retired the boot this March ..the fabric finally had enough...  but the soles were down to nothing left
.. I used the boot from walking ,going to church to walking around Hog island in Michigan to warren dunes state park in the winter hike... to Bedford Indiana blue springs cavern .... The Best Boot out on market. And a size 12. Thank you
review.name: The perfect boot

name: Fugitive GORE-TEX Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my 16-year-old daughter. she doesn't like big, heavy thick coats. This jacket fits here perfectly. The liner inside feels really soft. I would definitely recommend
review.name: Great Jacket!!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this shacket! I work in a corporate warehouse and it allows for a dressier feel!
review.name: I would buy this again!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good quality and fabric
review.name: I love this product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was very disappointed in the color. On line it shows sage and black but it came as sage and orange. I love north face but not this jackets color. I was thinking of ordering it in the grey but I'm worried the same thing will happen. It looks grey and like a purple color. But I'm sure it's not.
review.name: I'm going to try in another color and size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The color Misty Sage is nowhere even close to what is portrayed online! (See actual plaid in picture I attached below) Gross misrepresentation of color! To make matters worse TNF kept insisting 'we sent you the right color you ordered...' (Yeah, but......) Customer Service could not have cared less...back it goes.
review.name: Misty Sage is what it appears like online

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very nice Shirt or it can be a jacket. I love the color, it is cotton with polyester lining. Washes well.
review.name: Utility Top
